last_post.content:
@LeonDLotter @neuroscience @neuro @cognition @fmri @phdstudents @academicchatter

Very nice new & large #metaanalysis on #neuroimaging studies (#fMRI & #fNIRS) investigating #interpersonal #neural #synchrony (INS) in adults. Great work - congrats!

Especially great to see that there is (partial - #TPJ/#STG) overlap with our own #fNIRS #hyperscanning data looking at INS during #parent-#child interaction as part of our #CARE studies (https://pvrticka.com/attachment/care-studies/).

title: Call for Chapters: "ON NON-ANGLOPHONE EUROPEAN SCIENCE FICTION CINEMA" | H-Announce | H-Net

last_post.content:
Call for Chapters: "ON NON-ANGLOPHONE EUROPEAN SCIENCE FICTION CINEMA"

This edited volume will analyze how science fiction tropes are used by non-Anglophone European filmmakers to explore national and global issues, while taking into consideration the two-faced character of non-Anglophone European science fiction cinema.

Abstracts due on April 1st.

https://networks.h-net.org/node/73374/announcements/12227380/call-chapters-non-anglophone-european-science-fiction-cinema

#ScienceFiction #ScienceFictionCinema #EuropeanCinema #Utopia #Dystopia #GenderStudies

title: Improving PagerDuty’s Operational Resilience to Achieve our Long Term Vision and Goals

last_post.content:
In our book Calling Bullshit, we write about corporate weaselspeak and the way that it hides an often terrible human toll behind a smokescreen of jargon and passive voice.

Today's layoff announcement emailed to all PagerDuty employees is destined to become known as a classic of the genre.

As always, Jenny Bryan shared incredibly thoughtful reflections:

https://community.rstudio.com/t/posit-partners-with-palantir/157411/10

There’s been a lot of hubbub about the Posit “partnership” with with Palantir. It looks like what’s actually going on is Palantir has a compute platform that emphasizes isolation of rights. Posit has made it so their commercial product will run on that platform.

Posit has posted a response on their blog. One of the things I appreciate most about this blog post is it is signed by three executives by name.

https://posit.co/blog/posit-and-palantir/

title: 47% of UK businesses embarrassed by their website

last_post.content:
This is embarrassing.

We've got to do better than this as an industry. It's not *that* hard, you just have to *genuinely care* about your customers.

"92% [of businesses] think their website’s poor user experience is costing them sales" – https://www.chargedretail.co.uk/2023/01/25/47-of-uk-businesses-embarrassed-by-their-website/

Stop wasting your time on whatever JavaScript framework is in vogue this week and actually spend it using the site you've been working on for so long.

title: Do we need AI standards? — Careful Industries

last_post.content: I gave a (very) short talk this morning at the All Party Parliamentary Group on Data Interventions on why unequal societies create unfair AI, and how applying ethics and standards won’t fix that. I wrote it up as a very short blog post. https://www.careful.industries/blog/2023-1-do-we-need-ai-standards

In a big chunk of the call, we discuss why a full-fledged OSS app like @elk is beneficial to the @vite, @nuxt, and Vue ecosystems.

Improvements to Vite plugins, Vue libs, and Nuxt modules (even new ones created from the App needs). And huge amount of DX and UX data to further enhance them and test new ideas in the future.

Some of the most active maintainers of plugins and modules have integrated their libs themselves into the project. Diving into the code base of Elk could help you learn more about these tools and how they play together.

https://youtu.be/A1MuI1CzvQo
twitter doesn't even feature in the top 100 iphone apps lmao https://apps.apple.com/us/charts/iphone/social-networking-apps/6005?chart=top-free

Yesterday I had my first public demo of partykit. For about 8 hours people filtered in an out of a shared infinitely scrolling drawing (originally implemented by @steveruizok at https://codesandbox.io/s/yjs-multiplayer-drawing-app-q8wq5) It was so dope. Only some dicks and profanity, which was good. Overall a little under 3k people showed up, scaled really nicely. Really happy/proud of this.

Link to twitter thread: https://twitter.com/partykit_io/status/1617923830500167681

@rstats #tidyverse #dataviz #datavisualization

Welcome @tadirah ! May I immediately pose a question?

We are currently looking into how to use the #TaDiRAH taxonomy for tagging tools in #Wikidata. As it happens there is a TaDiRAH property (https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Property:P9309), which, however, seems to be intended for mirroring the TaDiRAH taxonomy on Wikidata. There is only a grand total of 9 items in Wikidata tagged with this property and was established in 2021 by Adam Schiff (not that one) from the University of Washington, Seattle.

Would anyone at @tadirah be willing to support creation of a different property for classifying tools, methods etc. through referencing TaDiRAH URIs?

#DigitalHumanities #LinkedOpenData #LOD #AuthorityControl #DH @dh

title: Reinhart Koselleck’s metaphorical language: an application of historical semantics to one of its founding figures

last_post.content:
Anyone who reads Reinhart Koselleck’s texts in German will be aware of two striking features in the ways he uses language: first, a frequent recourse to certain metaphorical expressions, and second, an extensive use of a limited number of rather peculiar words, or, contrariwise, of familiar words in an idiosyncratic way.

At ➡ Geschichtstheorie am Werk, Willibald Steinmetz applies historical semantics to one of its founders:

https://gtw.hypotheses.org/11421

#hypoverse #Koselleck100

Berlin life sciences researchers: Want to make your research more reproducible & transparent? Get started with ReproducibiliTeach (http://youtube.com/@reproducibiliteach).

In this 5-week virtual course, you’ll immediately apply skills in your own research. Topics include reporting guidelines, RRIDs, blinding & randomization plans, identifying & fixing common data visualization problems, writing/depositing protocols and data management.

Tuesdays, 4:00-5:30pm, Feb 21 - March 21. https://t1p.de/l9maa

The aim of https://Fedi.Garden is to help people discover small and medium sized servers on Mastodon and the Fediverse.

All of the servers listed comply with the Mastodon Covenant (https://joinmastodon.org/covenant), have fewer than 50,000 members and are open for public signups. They can be any sort of Fediverse server.

If you run such an instance, send me a message if you'd like to be listed.

title: What Makes a Dialog Agent Useful?

last_post.content: Nice short lit overview from HuggingFace folks, “What Makes a Dialog Agent Useful” https://huggingface.co/blog/dialog-agents #nlp #search

This feeling about TypeScript that @chriscoyier describes in https://chriscoyier.net/2023/01/24/you-like-it-because-you-know-it/ really hits home.

I found that TypeScript sometimes even took the joy out of _hacking_, to just start a dumb little project that might grow into something cool. Because TypeScript needs you to be neat and organised and serious—not brimming with energy, messy, experimental or to have fun slapping a prototype together.

The developer in me sees the benefit, but the carefree hacker in me just shrugs.

I immediately subscribed to the highest Ivory plan. They deserve our support!

Aristotle claimed that identical regular tetrahedra could be packed in a way that fills space. It seems unlikely if you actually try it - but only in 1925 was it proved impossible. And only in 2010 did people prove a nontrivial upper bound on the density of the packing you can achieve, namely

0.9999999999999999999999974

On the other hand, the densest known packing has density about .8563 - there's a discussion and picture on Wolfram's website:

https://blog.wolfram.com/2010/08/30/tetrahedra-packing/

(1/n)

title: Webb Unveils Dark Side of Pre-stellar Ice Chemistry

last_post.content:
Surprisingly not a still from a sci-fi movie, this new #JWST image shows us the central portion of the star-forming Chamaeleon I molecular cloud.

The cold, wispy cloud material (blue, center) is illuminated in the infrared by the glow of the young, outflowing protostar Ced 110 IRS 4 (orange, upper left). The ices in the cloud absorb some of the light of background stars (orange dots), allowing us to detect them.

Read more: https://webbtelescope.org/contents/news-releases/2023/news-2023-106

1/
#astrdon #astronomy #space

"In 2021 a record 48,000 Americans were killed by firearms, including suicides, homicides and accidents."

That's on the order of all American military fatalities (58,000) during the entire Vietnam war.

This is a sensible, balanced, and pragmatic argument for how to reduce that catastrophic harm.

tl;dr: regulation.

Remarkable new intracortical speech prosthesis BCI from Francis Willett, Erin Kunz, and colleages at Stanford. https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.01.21.524489v1

They achieved 23.8% word error rate on a 125k word vocabulary. Not only a huge step over previous systems, but that WER approaches Android's built-in speech recognition!

Also, successful decoding at 62 WPM (3.4x previous SotA). Really remarkable. And, at least at a high level, the ML architecture is surprisingly simple!

Soft launching a curated directory of Fediverse servers to join:

➡️ https://fedi.garden

To be listed, a site has to:

-Obey the Mastodon Covenant (but doesn't have to be running Mastodon)

-Have fewer than 50,000 registered members

-Be open for public registration, either directly or through requests

Unlike https://joinmastodon.org, this site will accept non-Mastodon instances, and has an upper size limit

Unlike https://instances.social etc this site is curated.

(1/2)

Auto-Encrypt Localhost v.8 released (complete rewrite)

There’s now a 100% JavaScript (no native dependencies) Node.js tool for creating locally-trusted development certificates on Linux, macOS, and Windows.

Heck, it’ll even create your https server for you, if you like, and serve the CA certificate at <your ip>/.ca and even forward HTTP traffic to HTTPS.

(I’m going to whip up a separate command-line client next.)

Enjoy!

https://www.npmjs.com/package/@small-tech/auto-encrypt-localhost

#SmallWeb #SmallTech #TLS #NodeJS #web #dev

@henryfarrell Just read it. I agree almost entirely, and in fact it's why the original title of my had some more general hedge around information technology instead of the phrase "social media". I'm careful, in general, to lay the blame on infotech including search engines rather than on social media in particular.

You've nicely illustrated the preferential attachment due to search engines. Jevin West was worried about this with Google Scholar and found partial support.

title: After Madera's hospital closure, could others follow?

last_post.content:
“In Madera County, one-fifth of residents live in poverty and many don’t have health insurance.

The last thing this largely rural, Latino-majority part of the San Joaquin Valley needed was for its only general hospital to close its doors.”

But then they closed.

My @CalMatters colleagues Ana Ibarra and Nicole Foy’s recent piece about a rural hospital closure in California, and how that might just be the start, is well worth your time.

https://calmatters.org/health/2023/01/hospital-closure/

title: At Patreon, Mismanagement Thwarts a Pandemic-Era Star

last_post.content: I’m now officially on the record for saying that Patreon’s business strategy and leadership team are not the best. Feels kinda good to say some of these things out loud that hundreds of current and ex-employees have been saying for years. Also… yeah kinda nerve-wracking. If you subscribe to The Information you can read it here: https://www.theinformation.com/articles/at-patreon-mismanagement-thwarts-a-pandemic-era-star

I already mentioned this a couple of times, that I was a #GooglePlus refugee.

I don't miss the app itself, or the interface, but the vibe and circle of folks you randomly meet there.

Is the #Fediverse close? No, but among the options we have left, the only one with similar vibes . Depends on the instance you're on.

For fun, if you do miss the app, I stumbled into a G+front-end for #mastodon: https://mastoplus.com

After checking it out, I realize #Fedilab is so much better. :mastolol:

title: The science of why you have great ideas in the shower

last_post.content:
Great article from one of @nickytonline 's newsletters!

This is part of my hang-up with why the modern version of work in fields that require more thought, creativity, and/or strategy is wrong. Working more hours doesn't necessarily give you better results. Stepping away and mind wandering can help you better overcome an impasse...
https://www.nationalgeographic.co.uk/history-and-civilisation/2022/08/the-science-of-why-you-have-great-ideas-in-the-shower

title: Microsoft's Changes to Xbox Console Leave Republicans Outraged

last_post.content:
Republicans are now angry that the Xbox will save them money by using less power when not in use and run updates during times when power is cheaper.

Remember when the stereotype was "who turned up the thermostat" and "who forgot to turn off the lights?" Now they want to waste power (and their own money) to own the libs.

"First gas stoves, then your coffee, now they're gunning for your Xbox," Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) tweeted on Monday

Grad students at Virginia Tech are still fighting for a living wage and the task force created by students' collective action and continued pressure will vote Thursday at 10am on a final report and recommendations. Several faculty and administration members on the Task Force have remained wholly unresponsive to student outreach and inquiries.

At this link you can find a list of all of the faculty and administrators on the Graduate Student Living Wage Task Force , as well as their university contact information and their salaries (100% publicly available data as with any state government employee):
https://reddit.com/r/VirginiaTech/comments/10khcxv/the_living_wage_task_force_votes_on_thursday/

If you're a Virginia Tech grad student, alumn, or sympathetic faculty, please contact at least one person here before 10am on 01/25/23 and tell the faculty and administrators at Virginia Tech in no uncertain terms that graduate student workers deserve a real living wage.

If you're not directly affiliated with VT, please spread the word.

title: New DOJ lawsuit could break up Google

last_post.content:
The U.S. Department of Justice filed a lawsuit against Google alleging the search and advertising behemoth illegally monopolized the market for online ads through a yearslong practice of self-dealing, anticompetitive acquisitions, and forcing businesses to use multiple products and services that it offers.

The DOJ seeks to restore competition to the markets by breaking up the company's ad business and imposing unspecified damages.

https://www.politico.com/news/2023/01/24/new-doj-lawsuit-could-break-up-google-00079229

#Google #US #DOJ #Justice #Monopoly #Search #Ads #Advertising #Tech #Lawsuit #Anticompetitive #TrustBusting
